summary: Build a courier tracking system website.
known_issues: User reports the website has no visible Admin option/admin interface entry point (admin panel missing or not accessible).

existing_features.title: Create a public shipment tracking experience: a page where a user can enter a tracking number and view the latest shipment details and full status timeline (date/time, location, status, optional note).

Add an admin interface secured by Internet Identity that allows an authenticated admin to: create a shipment (tracking number, origin, destination, recipient name optional), and append new tracking events (status, location, note optional, timestamp).

Create a coherent, modern visual theme for the website and apply it consistently across pages (typography, spacing, cards, forms, and status timeline). Use a warm logistics-inspired palette (e.g., charcoal + off-white + amber accents) and avoid blue/purple.
Add generated static brand assets and render them in the UI (header/landing and optionally favicon-style usage) from frontend/public/assets/generated.

Update the Admin Panel "Create Shipment" flow to support auto tracking ID generation: provide a UI control to generate/fill the Tracking Number field, and allow creating a shipment without manually typing a tracking number by generating one during submission when the field is empty.
Add a frontend React Query hook and wiring in the admin data layer to call the new backend tracking-number generation API using the authenticated actor (consistent with existing useAdmin hooks).

Update the global header navigation so the Admin panel entry point is visible and usable even when the user is not yet authenticated, while still protecting the /admin route with the existing AdminGuard.
Add a clear authentication control to the header (using the existing Internet Identity LoginButton) so users can sign in/out without needing to already know the /admin route.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a courier tracking system website (allow users to track shipments).
Implement backend data models and APIs for shipments and tracking events, including: create shipment, add tracking event, get shipment by tracking number, and list shipments for administration.

Define an initial authorization rule for admins in the backend (e.g., an allowlist of principals) and provide a simple way to manage it for initial deployment (at minimum: set the first admin to the canister installer/owner).

Add additional courier-company features requested by user, including auto tracking ID generation for new shipments (and potentially a booking form, rate calculator, and SMS/WhatsApp status update notifications).

Add a backend API that allows an authenticated admin to generate a new unique tracking number for a shipment, using a consistent courier-style format (e.g., a fixed prefix plus a time-based or other collision-resistant suffix) and guaranteeing it does not already exist in stored shipments.
